questiontext.text:
Below is a portion of an ANOVA table belonging to a CRD ANOVA with 5 groups and 3 measurements per group.

————— —- —- —- — — Source of variation df SS MS F P Among groups 4 48 Within groups 10 15 Total 14 63 ————— —- —- —- — —

Suppose the F-value of this ANOVA table was equal to 3.0; then the following would apply for the corresponding P value to hold (α=5%):

answer.text: P > 0.05: no significant differences between groups

feedback.text: P > 0.05: no significant differences between groups: Correct
P > 0.05: do have significant differences between groups: Incorrect

answer.text: P < 0.05: no significant differences between groups

feedback.text: P < 0.05: no significant differences between groups: Incorrect

answer.text: P > 0.05: do have significant differences between groups.

feedback.text: P > 0.05: significant differences between groups: Incorrect
